Build M5

I was importing external plugins using the PDE import wizard when the 
following error occurred:

I don't suppose it was reproducible?  What projects were you importing? What did 
you specify for the two options in the import wizard (extract source and copy 
contents)?  Was autobuild on?

No, I haven't seen the error again.
Autobuild was truned on.
Extract source was OFF.
Copy contents was ON.

Apparently I spoke too early.  The error just occurred again.

I was checking a project out of CVS and the error was logged to my .log file.

Was the second occurence in the same workbench instance as the first?  If the 
tree is already corrupt, I wouldn't be surprised if this continued to occur.  

To answer your other question, AbstractDataTreeNode.getData() throws an 
AbstractMethodError explicitly.  If this occurs it means the tree is certainly 
in a corrupt state.
*** Bug 16119 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Unable to reproduce.

If you see this again please try and save the workspace.
Also please include the full log file as in most cases it is more interesting 
to know what happened in the first place to corrupt the tree file.
Thanks.

Will investigate further post 2.0.

Closing.  Has not been reproduced since before release 2.0.

From looking at bug 16119 (same steps and results as this bug), I see this
happened in the same workspace that had the corruption due to bug 12575.  I
suspect this is actually another side effect of the tree corruption seen (and
fixed) in bug 12575.
